p: India is arguably the largest generic product production country in the world. It houses more than 20,000 pharmaceutical companies, around 260 of which are large-scale companies. India can produce nearly all popular domestic medicines and around 350 common medicines, which meets 70% of its domestic needs. Indian medicine accounts for 8% of the global medicine sales volume. It is the fifth largest producer of APIs worldwide, with an estimated market value of $0.8 billion and is increasing at the rate of 13.4% per year [ 39].
